snippet: The Chukchansi Indians recently pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno.
abstract: Chukchansi Indians, using revenues from their casino in Coarsegold, Calif, have pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno to help preserve their unwritten language; donation caps efforts by American Indian tribes across the nation to bring back their tongues before the death of their sole surviving speakers.
lead_paragraph: The Chukchansi Indians recently pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno.

headline.seo: Chukchansi Tribe in California Pushes to Preserve Language
headline.main: With Casino Revenues, Tribes Push to Preserve Languages, and Cultures
headline.print_headline: With Casino Revenues, Tribes Push to Preserve Languages, and Cultures
